intro: Oenanthe radiata, commonly known as the common water-dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist environments such as wet meadows, stream banks, and marshy areas. Oenanthe radiata is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
